transportAdvice: Pittsburgh is served by an extensive bus network and a light rail system that connects downtown to the South Hills, making tourist areas reasonably accessible by public transit; however, the city's hilly terrain and spread-out neighborhoods make a car or taxi useful for exploring beyond the core areas. Taxis and rideshare vehicles are widely available, and many downtown and riverside attractions are walkable from one another.

weather.description: Cold and often grey with occasional snow and freezing temperatures typical of a Rust Belt winter.
Still cold and wintry with a mix of snow, sleet, and overcast skies common throughout the month.
Early spring brings fluctuating temperatures and frequent rain as winter gradually loosens its grip.
Mild and increasingly pleasant with blooming trees, though showers remain frequent and temperatures vary day to day.
Warm and green with comfortable temperatures, making it one of the more enjoyable months to visit.
Warm to hot with rising humidity and occasional afternoon thunderstorms typical of early summer.
The hottest month of the year with high humidity and frequent thunderstorms, though outdoor festivals are in full swing.
Hot and humid similar to July, with afternoon storms possible and outdoor activities best enjoyed in the morning.
Comfortable early autumn temperatures with lower humidity and beautiful foliage beginning to appear by late month.
Crisp and colorful with peak fall foliage making this one of the most scenic months to explore the city and surrounding hills.
Cool and increasingly grey with rain and the first hints of winter cold arriving by late November.
Cold and often overcast with a chance of snow, though holiday lights and indoor cultural attractions keep the city lively.
